comments:
I tried to include Web AppLibraries as source java library to server lauch configuration. Double clicking the selection, not just pressing the next caused unexpected error. Afterward I get stuck on the dialogue unable to close it. This  happens often but not alway. 

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jface 4 2 2006-02-17 07:47:04.542
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.jface".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.jst.servlet.ui.internal.classpath.WebAppContainerPage.initialize(WebAppContainerPage.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.wizards.buildpaths.ClasspathContainerWizard.getContainerPage(ClasspathContainerWizard.java:159)

	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardPage.getNextPage(WizardPage.java:168)

Propably the server lauch configuration can't find the .settings folder since picklist has no references to a spesific project?

What I'm trying to do is to get source folders that I have tied with java libraries (including WTP web app lib) to be noticed, but I see that selecting java project only affects source folders, not java libraries that have sources attached to them. Selecting web app lib alone causes the bug, but I don't think it should even work alone decoupled from project.
This is a rather old code. I don't believe the problem exists any more. Try 1.0.2 or the latest release candidate of 1.5. If you are still able to repro, please re-open with a new stack trace.

This is merely a cosmetic prolem that I'm still able to reproduce with the latest Callisto release, but since this has no importance to anybody except for those who by accident wind up selecting the library I'm now reducing the severity.
